definitions: Propel (something) with great force, especially with a rapid movement of the arm and shoulder.
Hurl or cast something in a specified direction.
Cause to fall or be displaced from an upright position.
Move or place something quickly or carelessly.
Direct (a look, remark, or question) at someone.
Cause (someone) to be in a specified state or situation.
examples: She can throw a ball a long way.
He threw the javelin over seventy meters.
She threw her coat on the bed.
He threw a glance at his watch.
The news threw her into a panic.
They're throwing a party next week.
